title: ICE when compiling lewton

labels.name: A-macros
labels.description: Area: All kinds of macros (custom derive, macro_rules!, proc macros, ..)

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-nightly
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to nightly.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
When on latest rust nightly `f09420685 2016-10-20`, you get an ICE when compiling [lewton](https://github.com/est31/lewton).

```
error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace

thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', ../src/libcore/option.rs:323
stack backtrace:
   1:     0x7f78233a903f - std::sys::backtrace::tracing::imp::write::h22f199c1dbb72ba2

error: Could not compile `lewton`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```
